snippet: The Canadian company SNC-Lavalin had paid more than $100,000 to a consultant charged in what the authorities call a plot to smuggle one of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi’s sons into Mexico.
abstract: Canadian company SNC-Lavalin's says it has fired two executives who were connected to Cynthia Vanier, consultant charged by Mexican authorities in plot to smuggle Muammar el-Qaddafi's son Saadi into Mexico; announcement brings lingering suspicions of the company's involvement in the plot to forefront.

byline.original: By IAN AUSTEN and ELISABETH MALKIN
byline.contributor: Ian Austen reported from Ottawa, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The Canadian company SNC-Lavalin had paid more than $100,000 to a consultant charged in what the authorities call a plot to smuggle one of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi’s sons into Mexico.

headline.seo: SNC-Lavalin Swept Up in Suspected Plot to Smuggle a Qaddafi
headline.main: Canadian Company Swept Up in Suspected Plot to Smuggle a Qaddafi
headline.print_headline: Canadian Company Swept Up in Suspected Plot to Smuggle a Qaddafi
